article_title: Member of Indonesian Anticorruption Panel Detained
article_text:
JAKARTA, Indonesia—Long-running tensions between Indonesian police and the nation’s top antigraft officials escalated on Friday when police detained a member of an anticorruption panel, which led President Joko Widodo to ask both sides to avoid friction.

Police detained Bambang Widjojanto, one of four deputy chairmen of Indonesia’s Corruption Eradication Commission, after naming him a suspect in a legal case concerning a regional...
